name: treatment of waste plastic, consumer electronics, sanitary landfill, wet infiltration class (500mm) | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18734/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'waste plastic, consumer electronics' in a sanitary landfill. Recommended use of this dataset: for waste material going to unsanitary landfill in a wet water infiltration class location, as part of unsorted, unmanaged, unscavenged municipal waste mixture. Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% Plastics from electronic consumer goods; . Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): gross heating value 36.29 MJ/kg; net heating value 34.78 MJ/kg; H2O 11129; O 41000; H 75000; C 821000; S 300; N 13100; P 600; B na; Cl 6300; Br 6800; F 130; I na; Ag na; As 10; Ba 137; Cd 115; Co 29.478; Cr 34; Cu 3194.1; Hg 1.4; Mn 4; Mo 2; Ni 703; Pb 127; Sb 4795.2; Se 1.9596; Sn 267; V 0.5; Zn 361; Be 0.46656; Sc na; Sr 82.582; Ti 4187; Tl 0.37325; W na; Si 3547; Fe 1483; Ca 3177; Al 2020; K 233; Mg na; Na 128. Share of carbon in initial waste waste that is biogenic 0%. Share of metals in waste not oxidised and bulk-recyclable (exclude very small or thin parts) Iron: 0%; Alu: 0%; Copper: 0%. Overall degradability of waste during 100 years: 1%. Landfill gas capture and utilisation generates 0.006221 kWh of electricity and 0.01122 MJ of useful heat. 0.008396 kg waste mass remains in the landfill even after the long term period.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to the environment (air due to landfil gas, water due to landfil leachate, and subsequent into groundwater).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents a landfill of infiltration class 4 wet (W). The site has mean annual temperature (MAT) of 8 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 1100 mm/year, and net infiltration of 500 mm/year. The leachate percolating through the landfill has an average residence time of 10 years.;Reference for climatic parameters: Reference for climatic parameters: Doka, G., 2018, Inventory parameters for regionalised waste disposal mixes
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for a sanitary (controlled) landfill for municipal solid waste. Ultimate average landfill height is 20 meters. Operation phase duration is 30 years. The total raw landfill gas mass produced in the landfill from this waste is 0.009113 kg. The total CH4 mass in the raw landfill gas is 0.007961 kg. Percentage of landfill gas directly emitted is 47w%. Percentage of landfill gas captured and flared is 18.02w%. Percentage of landfill gas captured and utilised is 34.98%. Conversion efficiencies are 27.8e% for electricity and 13.5e% for useful heat.  Leachate collected during the first 100 years is collected and treated region-specifically before emission. Based on average waste composition and climate data the end of carbonate phase is estimated to be reached 4'476 years after waste deposition.

exchanges.description: Net production of heat from landfill gas utilisation.

flow.name: heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard
